intro: Miscanthidium gossweileri, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, feathery leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and distinctive scent. Miscanthidium gossweileri is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
